page.title: 08APPLE PRODUCTION (page 4)
page.content:
Every apple farmer has his own {GAS STORE}in which the fruit is kept until April or May,depending on public demand. The apples are perfect,just like the fresh fruit. These stores are kept at a constant low temperature. As apples ripen they give off carbon dioxide,but the low temperature controls this,putting the apples into a "dormant" state and thus preventing further ripening. The stores are divided into separate sealed sections so that one section can be emptied without disturbing the others,and when empty need not be temperature-controlled.
During harvesting many extra people are employed,both for the pulling of the apples and in the various processing factories concerned.
